body.p: The Board decided that, when an entity loses investment entity status, it should account for that change as a ‘deemed acquisition’. That is, the investment entity would use the fair value of the investment at the date of the change of status as the ‘deemed’ consideration transferred to obtain control of the investee. This recognises the change in status in the same way as a business combination achieved in stages, as described in IFRS 3. This would result in the recognition of goodwill or a gain on a bargain purchase.
